Komite Pemantau: Kasus Desa Fiktif Kritikan Keras bagi Kemenkeu
07 Nov 2019, 03:17 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Komite Pemantau: Kasus Desa Fiktif Kritikan Keras bagi Kemenkeu

KBRN, Jakarta : Direktur Eksekutif Komite Pemantauan Pelaksanaan Otonomi Daerah (KPPOD), Robert Andi Jaweng mengatakan, Kementerian Keuangan (Kemenkau) RI mesti dikritik keras apabila kasus dugaan puluhan desa fiktif di Kabupaten Konawe, Provinsi Sulawesi Tenggara (Sultra) benar-benar terbukti.Sebab, menurut dia, kementerian yang dipimpin oleh Sri Mulyani Indrawati (SMI) itu seolah-olah tidak melakukan verifikasi dan validasi terlebih dahulu sebelum mengucurkan Dana Desa (DD) ke desa-desa yang sebetulnya fiktif."Saya kira ini juga kritikan terhadap pusat. Bagaimana mungkin Kementerian Keuangan mengalokasikan dana desa melalui kabupaten tentu saja tanpa suatu kepastian melalui verifikasi dan validasi misalnya," tegasnya saat berbincang dengan Radio Republik Indonesia, Rabu (6/11/2019).Padahal validasi dan verifikasi paling gampang menurut dia adalah berbasis pada data kode desa atau kode wilayah yang dikeluarkan oleh Kementerian Dalam Negeri (Kemendagri)."Agar memastikan bahwa yang menerima ini sudah sah dan sudah secara administratif terdaftar di kode wilayah atau kode desanya Kemendagri," ujarnya.Perlu diketahui, dugaan tindak pidana korupsi atas pembentukan desa yang tidak sesuai prosedur sah bisa berakibatÂ  pada kerugian keuangan negara atau daerah atas Dana Desa (DD) serta Alokasi Dana Desa (ADD) yang dikelola beberapa desa di Kabupaten Konawe Tahun Anggaran 2016 sampai dengan Tahun Anggaran 2018.Sejauh ini Polda Sultra telah menemukan adanya indikasi 34 desa fiktif di Kabupaten Konawe. Untuk menyelesaikan kasus tersebut, Polda Sultra telah berkoordinasi dengan Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK)."(Kalau terbukti merugikan keuangan negara) ini berarti Kemenkeu percaya saja terhadap usulan yang muncul dari tingkat kabupaten dan kemudian diperhitungkan jumlah dana yang ditransfer ke kabupaten buang kemudian akan meneruskan itu ke tingkat desa," pungkasnya kembali menyesalkan. (Foto: Antara/Muhammad Adimaja)

Monitoring Committee: Fictitious Village Case Criticism Hard for Ministry of Finance
Nov 7 2019, 03:17 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Monitoring Committee: Fictitious Village Case Criticism Hard for Ministry of Finance

KBRN, Jakarta: Executive Director of the Regional Autonomy Implementation Monitoring Committee (KPPOD), Robert Andi Jaweng said, the Ministry of Finance (Kemenkau) of Indonesia must be strongly criticized if the alleged cases of dozens of fictitious villages in Konawe Regency, Southeast Sulawesi (Sultra) are truly proven. Because, according to him, the ministry led by Sri Mulyani Indrawati (SMI) seemed not to do verification and validation before disbursing the Village Fund (DD) to villages that were actually fictitious. "I think this is also a criticism of the center. How could the Ministry of Finance allocate village funds through the district, of course, without certainty through verification and validation for example, "he stressed when talking with Radio Republik Indonesia, Wednesday (11/06/2019). Whereas the easiest validation and verification according to him is based on data village code or area code issued by the Ministry of the Interior (Ministry of Home Affairs). "To ensure that the mene This rhyme is already legal and has been administratively registered in the Ministry of Home Affairs region code or village code, "he said. Keep in mind, allegations of corruption in the formation of villages that are not in accordance with legal procedures could result in state or regional financial losses to the Village Fund (DD) as well as Village Fund Allocation (ADD) managed by a number of villages in Konawe District, Fiscal Year 2016 to 2018 Fiscal Year. So far the Southeast Sulawesi Regional Police have found indications of 34 fictitious villages in Konawe District. To resolve the case, the Southeast Sulawesi Regional Police has coordinated with the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK). "(If proven to be detrimental to state finances) this means that the Ministry of Finance believes in proposals that arise from the district level and then calculates the amount of funds transferred to the disposed districts and then will continue "to the village level," he concluded with regret. (Photo: Antara / Muhammad Adimaja)
